jobs.title: Junior People Operations Associate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Climatiq

We are a fast-growing climate tech startup on a mission to drive climate action through data and insight. Our team consists of entrepreneurs, technologists, and scientists who have come from backgrounds such as Google, MIT, and other leading companies and academic institutions. Together, we are building a tech platform that empowers organizations to tackle the climate crisis. Our powerful carbon calculation engine helps software providers embed emission metrics into their solutions to help their customers accurately calculate and continuously monitor their carbon footprint and drive better decisions.

Our platform is used by tens of thousands of sustainability leaders worldwide, and we are proud to be backed by renowned international VCs and investors in the climate-tech and software sector. We are also a certified B Corp, highlighting our commitment to balancing purpose and profit. As a remote-first company, our team is spread out across Berlin and other parts of Europe, with a strong focus on collaboration and innovation.

This is an exciting time to join Climatiq. Be part of a real, technology-driven endeavor from the beginning. Work with an amazing team and help build something meaningful together with our community.

About the role

We are looking for a proactive and curious Junior People Operations to support and grow our internal operations. This role is designed for someone eager to learn across multiple areas, from finance and people operations to office and event coordination. You'll partner directly with our Head of Operations, taking ownership of the systems that power our company behind the scenes. You'll drive critical workflows across finance, compliance, vendor coordination, people operations and internal tools - making sure everything runs smoothly as we scale.We are growing fast, so this role can grow with your interests over time, whether you want to deepen expertise in finance or people operations, or continue developing as a broad operations generalist.

What you’ll do

  • Support invoicing, bookkeeping, and vendor payments

  • Assist with onboarding, contracts, and internal documentation

  • Coordinate office supplies, logistics, and vendor relationships

  • Organize meetings, team events, and company offsites

  • Handle ad hoc operational tasks and internal process improvements

  • Maintain HR records and support people-related requests

What we’re looking for

  • 1–3 years experience in operations, admin, HR, or business support

  • Organized and detail-oriented with a hands-on approach

  • Clear communicator who works well across teams

  • Comfortable with shifting tasks and priorities

  • Familiar with Google Workspace, Notion, Slack, and basic HR or finance tools

  • Fluent in English and ideally a B1/B2 level of German

Additional Information

Location: Berlin based, hybrid from our office at B-Part Gleisdreieck
Starting date: As soon as possible
Hours: Full-time, flexible working hours
Compensation: Competitive salary and benefits, including employee stock options, learning and development stipend, regular team offsites, and more

As a certified B Corp, Climatiq is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply for roles on our team.

jobs.title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Climatiq

We are a fast-growing climate tech startup on a mission to drive climate action through data and insight. Our team consists of entrepreneurs, technologists, and scientists who have come from backgrounds such as Google, MIT, and other leading companies and academic institutions. Together, we are building a tech platform that empowers organizations to tackle the climate crisis.

Our powerful carbon calculation engine helps software providers embed emission metrics into their solutions to help their customers accurately calculate and continuously monitor their carbon footprint and drive better decisions.

Our platform is used by tens of thousands of sustainability leaders worldwide, and we are proud to be backed by renowned international VCs and investors. We are also a certified B Corp, highlighting our commitment to balancing purpose and profit. As a remote-first company, our team is spread across Berlin and other parts of Europe, with a strong focus on collaboration and innovation.

About the Role

In this role, you will:

  • Design, build, and maintain modern frontend features across our core web applications and interfaces

  • Collaborate closely with product, design, and backend engineering to deliver intuitive, performant user experiences

  • Take ownership of key frontend components and contribute to architectural decisions

  • Develop and iterate on full-stack features, using TypeScript across the stack and Next.js on the frontend

  • Shape the look, feel, and functionality of data-intensive tools that empower users to understand and reduce their emissions

This role is part of the Engineering team — a group focused on building scalable infrastructure for carbon intelligence, working closely with product managers and climate scientists.

What We’re Looking For

Role Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience building frontend and full-stack applications, ideally in SaaS environments

  • 3+ years of production experience with TypeScript and Next.js, building and maintaining full-featured web applications

  • Proficiency in RESTful API integration, state management, and component-based UI architecture

  • Strong working knowledge of PostgreSQL or similar databases

  • Familiarity with Rust and/or AWS infrastructure is a plus

  • Structured, outcome-oriented mindset with strong problem-solving and communication skills

  • Self-driven and comfortable working autonomously in a distributed team setting

Additional Information

Location: Berlin or Remote within +/- 2 hours of CET

Start date: As soon as possible

Type: Full-time, flexible working hours

Compensation: Competitive salary and benefits, including employee stock options, learning stipend, regular team offsites, and more

Why Join Us?

  • Make a real impact on climate change through technology

  • Join a collaborative, values-driven and mission-first team

  • Work on challenging and meaningful problems from Day 1

  • Enjoy a remote-first culture and flexible working arrangements

As a certified B Corp, Climatiq is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply for roles on our team. Send us your CV and a short cover letter, highlighting your skills and experience, relevant for the advertised role.

jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Climatiq

We are a fast-growing climate tech startup on a mission to drive climate action through data and insight. Our team brings together entrepreneurs, technologists, and scientists from backgrounds such as Google, MIT, and other leading companies and academic institutions.

Together, we are building a technology platform that empowers organizations to tackle the climate crisis. Our powerful carbon calculation engine enables software providers to embed emission metrics into their solutions—helping their customers accurately calculate, continuously monitor, and reduce their carbon footprint.

Our platform is trusted by tens of thousands of sustainability leaders worldwide, and we are proud to be backed by renowned international VCs and investors in the climate-tech and software sectors. As a certified B Corp, we are committed to balancing purpose and profit.

As a remote-first company, our team is spread across Berlin and other parts of Europe, with a strong focus on collaboration and innovation.

About the Role

We are looking for a (Senior) Product Marketing Manager to join as the first dedicated PMM at Climatiq. This is an opportunity to shape the go-to-market (GTM) strategy of a fast-growing startup as we expand into new markets and address new personas.

You will be a key member of our Growth team—working closely with Sales to drive enablement and customer insights, with Product to feed into and communicate the roadmap, and with Marketing to support lead generation and brand growth.

Reporting to the Director of Marketing, this role is central to building on our existing brand and positioning while supporting our expansion into new personas and product offerings. It’s an opportunity to demonstrate the direct impact of product marketing on revenue while influencing how businesses worldwide assess and manage their carbon emissions.

What You’ll Do

  • Develop compelling messaging, value propositions, and enablement content for sustainability professionals delivering carbon emission reports

  • Accelerate our product-led growth engine through content, webinars, copy, and campaigns

  • Manage successful product launches by leading the GTM strategy for new product segments and features—including messaging, positioning, pricing, packaging, and demos

  • Conduct competitive and market analysis to guide the product roadmap and support Sales with insights

  • Create enablement and conversion-focused content, while collaborating with the Marketing team to deliver full-funnel campaigns

  • Support field marketing activities, including industry events and conferences (e.g. presentations, workshops)

What We’re Looking For

  • 3+ years of marketing experience in a product-focused B2B SaaS environment

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English

  • Experience working in a high-growth startup or scale-up environment

  • Proactive, self-driven, and comfortable working with ambiguity

  • Exceptional attention to detail and a structured approach to work

  • A good eye for design and the ability to collaborate with design resources

  • Experience with product-led growth is a plus, but not required

Additional Information

  • Location: Berlin (hybrid, at least two days a week in-office)

  • Starting date: As soon as possible

  • Hours: Full-time, flexible working hours

Climatiq is an equal-opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply. Please send us your CV and a short cover letter highlighting your skills and experience.

jobs.title: Intern - Sales and Legal Operations
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Climatiq

We are a fast-growing climate tech startup on a mission to drive climate action through data and insight. Our team consists of entrepreneurs, technologists, and scientists who have come from backgrounds such as Google, MIT, and other leading companies and academic institutions. Together, we are building a tech platform that empowers organizations to tackle the climate crisis. Our powerful carbon calculation engine helps software providers embed emission metrics into their solutions to help their customers accurately calculate and continuously monitor their carbon footprint and drive better decisions.

Our platform is used by tens of thousands of sustainability leaders worldwide, and we are proud to be backed by renowned international VCs and investors in the climate-tech and software sector. We are also a certified B Corp, highlighting our commitment to balancing purpose and profit. As a remote-first company, our team is spread out across Berlin and other parts of Europe, with a strong focus on collaboration and innovation.

This is an exciting time to join Climatiq. Be part of a real, technology-driven endeavor from the beginning. Work with an amazing team and help build something meaningful together with our community.

About the role

Climatiq is looking for an motivated and ambitious intern in Sale Operations to help us build out efficient processes for the Sales, Partnerships and Customer Success teams and enable them to better serve our customers. This involves understanding and categorising existing legal agreements (standard vs nonstandard term), reviewing vendor contracts, setting up processes in Hubspot or other tools we are using and more.

This is a 6 months internship, full time and based in Berlin, and could potentially be converted into a full time role based on performance.

As a Sales Operations Intern, you'll play a key role in ensuring our sales and customer success teams have the tools and data they need to succeed. You'll assist with a variety of tasks that contribute to the smooth operation of our sales processes, from maintaining data integrity to helping with reporting and analysis. This internship is perfect for someone who is eager to learn and can manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

What you'll do

  • Data Management: Help maintain and clean data in our CRM (e.g. Hubspot), ensuring information is accurate and up-to-date.

  • Legal Integrity: Categorising and organising legal documents and agreements with vendors and customers

  • Reporting & Analysis: Assist in creating and running reports on sales performance, pipeline health, and other key metrics.

  • Process Improvement: Identify and suggest ways to streamline and improve our sales operations processes.

  • Tool Support: Provide basic support for our sales tech stack, helping with user access and troubleshooting.

  • General Support: Assist the Sales Operations team with various administrative tasks and special projects as needed.

What we're looking for

  • A current student or recent graduate pursuing a degree in Business, Economics, Law or a related field.

  • Highly proficient with Google Sheets (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, etc.)

  • Highly detail-oriented and analytical, with a knack for spotting inconsistencies in data and legal contracts

  • A strong communicator who can work well both independently and as part of a team.

  • Eager to learn and not afraid to ask questions.

  • Bonus points if you have experience with a CRM like Hubspot or other sales tools.

Additional Information

  • Location: Berlin, hybrid (2-3 days in office per week)

  • Starting date: As soon as possible

  • Hours: Full-time, flexible working hours

  • Compensation: Competitive salary and benefits, including employee stock options, learning and development stipend, regular team offsites, and more

As a certified B Corp, Climatiq is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply for roles on our team. Send us your CV and a short cover letter, highlighting your skills and experience, relevant for the advertised role.

jobs.title: Senior Technical Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Climatiq

We are a fast-growing climate tech startup on a mission to drive climate action through data and insight. Our team consists of entrepreneurs, technologists, and scientists who have come from backgrounds such as Google, MIT, and other leading companies and academic institutions. Together, we are building a tech platform that empowers organizations to tackle the climate crisis. Our powerful carbon calculation engine helps software providers embed emission metrics into their solutions to help their customers accurately calculate and continuously monitor their carbon footprint and drive better decisions.

Our platform is used by tens of thousands of sustainability leaders worldwide, and we are proud to be backed by renowned international VCs and investors in the climate-tech and software sector. We are also a certified B Corp, highlighting our commitment to balancing purpose and profit. As a remote-first company, our team is spread out across Berlin and other parts of Europe, with a strong focus on collaboration and innovation.

This is an exciting time to join Climatiq. Be part of a real, technology-driven endeavor from the beginning. Work with an amazing team and help build something meaningful together with our community.

About the role

You’ll own Autopilot, our flagship AI product turning unstructured business data into carbon insights via NLP & ML on Climatiq’s emissions dataset. Making Climatiq's data accessible to sustainability professionals is a key objective for this role. This role provides a growth opportunity to manage a broader product portfolio.

You’ll report to the CEO and partner with the CTO and Product Director to bridge product and technology, working alongside product leaders and a cross-functional team of ML engineers, full-stack and data engineers, climate scientists, and carbon accounting experts to drive innovation and execution. This role goes beyond feature builds. Your work will empower thousands of enterprises to measure, report, and act on emissions effortlessly.

If you're passionate about leveraging cutting-edge technology to accelerate climate action, we want to hear from you.

What you’ll do

  • Define and own Autopilot’s roadmap, aligning development with business goals

  • Set and track product metrics, KPIs and OKRs to demonstrate impact

  • Partner with Engineering to turn customer insights into prioritized, measurable improvements

  • Produce and maintain clear product docs and work with Marketing on positioning

  • Conduct market and competitive analysis to uncover growth opportunities and risks

What we’re looking for

  • 5+ years leading technical data-driven in B2B SaaS/PaaS from concept through launch

  • Excellent communication skills to connect with internal teams and external customers

  • Proven ability to build relationships across engineering, sales and customer success in a fast-paced startup

  • Passion for climate-tech and data-driven sustainability (industry experience is a plus)

  • Optional: eligible to work in Germany

  • Bonus: Understanding of ML workflows; proficiency with Python \ R

Additional Information

  • Location: Berlin or Remote within +/- 2 hours of CET timezone

  • Starting date: As soon as possible

  • Hours: Full-time, flexible working hours

  • Compensation: Competitive salary and benefits, including employee stock options, learning and development stipend, regular team offsites, and more

As a certified B Corp, Climatiq is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply for roles on our team. Send us your CV and a short cover letter, highlighting your skills and experience, relevant for the advertised role.
